video_caption: The video begins with a white screen that transitions to an animated logo featuring two children, one in a blue shirt and the other in a pink shirt, reading a book together. The text "YesLearners" appears below the logo, followed by the phrase "you are learning..." and the website "www.yeslearners.com" displayed at the bottom. The scene then shifts to a blue rectangle with the word "Vitamins" in white text, accompanied by the "YesLearners" logo in the top right corner. The video concludes with a red "SUBSCRIBE" button and a YouTube subscription graphic, encouraging viewers to subscribe to the channel. The background remains consistently white throughout the video, maintaining a clean and simple aesthetic.

The video begins with a title screen featuring the word "Vitamins" in a blue box at the top left corner, accompanied by the logo and website of YesLearners in the top right corner. Below the title, two black-and-white portraits of Frederick Hopkins and Kazimierz Funk are displayed, with their names written in yellow and blue boxes respectively. The scene transitions to a list of fat-soluble vitamins (A, D, E, K) in an orange box and water-soluble vitamins (B, C) in a green box, both under the "Vitamins" title. The video then focuses on Vitamin A1, showing "Retinol" in a blue box and "Night Blindness" in an orange box, with an image of a car driving at night. Next, Vitamin A2 is presented with "Dehydro Retinol" in a yellow box and "Xerophthalmia" in a green box, accompanied by a close-up of an eye. The video continues with a collage of images related to Vitamin A, including carrots, leafy greens, a close-up of an eye, and a glass of milk, all under the "Vitamin A" title. The final scene highlights "Pro Vitamin A" in a white box, "Beta Carotene" in a yellow box, and an assortment of orange and yellow fruits and vegetables, such as carrots, butternut squash, mangoes, and papayas, with the YesLearners logo and website in the top right corner throughout the video.

The video begins with a slide introducing Vitamin D, also known as Calciferol, and its association with two conditions: Rickets and Osteomalacia. The slide features images of a child with bowed legs, indicative of Rickets, and a spine with a curvature, representing Osteomalacia. The background is a simple gradient, and the logo of YesLearners is visible in the top right corner. The video then transitions to a slide on Osteoporosis, highlighting the porous nature of bones due to calcium deficiency, accompanied by images of bone cross-sections. Following this, another slide emphasizes Vitamin D's nickname as the "Sunshine Vitamin," "Anti Ricketic Vitamin," and "Steroid Vitamin," with a cheerful sun icon in the top left corner. The video then shifts focus to Vitamin E, also known as Tocopherol, and its link to sterility, illustrated by an image of a couple with a baby and cracked eggs. The background remains consistent with a gradient, and the YesLearners logo is present throughout. The video concludes with a slide reiterating the information on Vitamin E, Tocopherol, and sterility, maintaining the same visual elements and layout.

The video features an educational slide about Vitamin K, presented by YesLearners, as indicated by their logo in the top right corner. The slide is divided into three sections, each with a different background color and text. The top section, with a white background, reads "Vitamin K" in bold black letters. Below it, the middle section has a green background and states "Phylloquinone" in bold black letters. The bottom section, with an orange background, reads "Coagulation Vitamin" in bold black letters. The final section, with a yellow background, reads "Haemophilia" in bold black letters. To the right of the text, there is an image of a blood vessel with blood splashing out, illustrating the concept of coagulation. The slide is set against a grey background, and the overall design is clean and informative, aimed at educating viewers about the role of Vitamin K in blood clotting and its relation to haemophilia.

The video begins with a slide titled "Vitamin K," featuring the term "Phylloquinone" and the phrase "Coagulation Vitamin" in a green box, alongside an image of blood vessels with red blood cells flowing through them. The slide also includes the term "Haemophilia" in a yellow box. The background is a gradient of gray, and the logo of "YesLearners" is visible in the top right corner. The scene transitions to a slide about "Vitamin B1," with the term "Thiamine" in a green box and "Beriberi Disease" in a yellow box, accompanied by an image of hands affected by the disease. The background remains gray, and the "YesLearners" logo is still present. The next slide focuses on "Vitamin B2," with "Riboflavin" in a green box and "Ariboflavinosis" in a yellow box, along with an image of lips affected by the condition. The background continues to be gray, and the "YesLearners" logo is visible. The final slide in this sequence also discusses "Vitamin B2," highlighting "Protein Synthesis" in a green box and "Yellow colour of milk" in a yellow box, with no additional images. The background remains consistent throughout, and the "YesLearners" logo is present in the top right corner. The video then transitions to a slide with the title "Vitamin B2" in a white box at the top, "Protein Synthesis" in a green box in the middle, and "Yellow colour of milk" in a yellow box at the bottom. The background is a gradient of gray, and the logo of "YesLearners" is visible in the top right corner. The slide remains static, with no additional images or text, and the background and logo remain consistent throughout the video.

The video features a series of educational slides from YesLearners.com, each detailing different vitamins and their associated functions and deficiencies. The first slide introduces Vitamin B2, highlighting its role in protein synthesis and the yellow color of milk. The second slide focuses on Vitamin B3, also known as Niacin or Nicotinic Acid, and its connection to Pellagra and the 4 D Syndrome, accompanied by an image of hands affected by the condition. The third slide presents Vitamin B5, or Pantothenic Acid, and its link to Paresthesia. The fourth slide discusses Vitamin B6, Pyridoxine, and its relation to Anaemia. The fifth slide covers Vitamin B7, Biotin, also known as Vitamin H, and its association with Seborrhea and the ELISA test. The sixth slide introduces Vitamin B9, Folic Acid, and its role in preventing Megaloblastic Anaemia. The final slide details Vitamin B12, Cyanocobalamin, a cobalt-containing vitamin found in rainwater, and its connection to Pernicious Anaemia. The slides maintain a consistent design with a grey background, white text boxes, and colored text boxes for additional information, with the YesLearners.com logo visible in the top right corner throughout the video.

The video begins with a slide titled "Vitamin B12" in bold letters, followed by a list of key points about the vitamin, including its chemical name "Cyanocobalamin," its association with cobalt, its presence in rainwater, and its relevance to "Pernicious anaemia." The slide features a logo in the top right corner with the text "YesLearners" and a website address. The background is a gradient of light grey. The video then transitions to a slide about "Vitamin C," highlighting its chemical name "Ascorbic Acid," its role in preventing "Scurvy," and its historical significance as the "Sailors plague." The same logo and website address are present, and the background remains consistent. The next slide continues the discussion on Vitamin C, emphasizing its presence in "Fresh food vitamin" and its benefits as an "Anti cancer vitamin." The slide includes images of various fruits and vegetables, such as oranges, strawberries, and tomatoes, to illustrate the sources of Vitamin C. The video maintains a clean and educational design throughout, with a focus on delivering information about vitamins in a visually appealing manner.

The video begins with a white background featuring a play button icon and the text "thanks for watching" in teal, followed by a thumbs-up icon with the text "drop a like" and an envelope icon with the text "leave a comment," all in teal. The scene transitions to a teal background with the text "and don't forget to SUBSCRIBE" in white, with "SUBSCRIBE" highlighted in a white box. Below this, the website "www.yeslearners.com" appears in white text within a purple box. The video maintains this teal background and text throughout, emphasizing the call to action for viewers to subscribe and visit the website.
